intro: Clethra cavaleriei var. leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaved sweet pepper tree, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually hairy on the underside, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
